title: Calories in a Fried Egg
meta_description: Discover calories in a fried egg, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown, and simple tweaks for variations.
assumptions: Large egg (~50 g), fried in 1 tsp oil or butter, sunny-side up, minimal added salt.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by egg size, frying fat amount, cooking time, and added seasonings. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A single fried egg provides ~92 kcal and ~6 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Fried in 1 tbsp oil instead of 1 tsp
Poached instead of fried (no added fat)

faqs.q: How many calories in a fried egg?
faqs.a: About 92 kcal for one large fried egg.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a fried egg?
faqs.a: Roughly 6.3 g protein per large fried egg.

faqs.q: Does frying an egg add many calories?
faqs.a: Yes, the added fat from oil or butter increases calories by 30-80 kcal depending on amount used.

faqs.q: Fried egg vs boiled egg calories?
faqs.a: A fried egg has ~92 kcal vs ~78 kcal for boiled, due to cooking fat.

faqs.q: How much fat is in a fried egg?
faqs.a: About 7 g total fat, including 2 g saturated fat, per large egg.
